availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas D. Godman (Bourbon County, Kentucky, resident and soldier)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Melvin Godman and Mary Godman. Resident of Bourbon County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in 1850. Resident of Bourbon County in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from December 14, 1861, to January 14, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 292B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 25.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, District 1, p. 533.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0283.
